newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore Changi airport T3 building expected 1999.
newsitem.headline: Singapore Changi airport T3 building expected 1999.

text.p: Construction of the third terminal at Singapore's Changi airport is expected to begin in 1999, Minister for Communications Mah Bow Tan said on Monday.
Mah said completion of the work was scheduled for 2003 and the terminal was likely to commence operations in 2004.

Mah said in a speech that Changi airport handled 23 million passengers in 1995 and was expected to handle 25 million this year. The airport's two existing passenger terminals would reach their full capacity in less than 10 years, he said.

"The government has decided to start work on Terminal Three before full capacity is reached in Terminals One and Two," Mah said. "Detailed design will begin next year, and construction will begin when the design is ready, which we expect to be in 1999, with completion scheduled for 2003.
"Terminal Three is expected to commence operations in 2004," he added.
He said the new terminal would be able to handle the planned 600-seater super-jumbo aircraft.
